topics.body:
Go Ukraine!

You know how separatists have been pushing further in Ukraine?  Well the people of Ukraine have officially fucking had enough and are uniting to push the separatists out and the separatist's control is actually reversing.

Ukraine uses, "GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!"
It's super effective.

Yeah it's game over cause what is Russia or the separatists going to do?  Start mowing down tens of thousands of civilians?  Yeah I'm totally sure that won't have any huge ass repercussions(extreme sarcasm).  If Russia wants Ukraine their only option left would be to just start gunning every civilian down.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5375931c6368724880bb0300#post_5375931c6368724880bb0300

How better/worse is Ukraine's economy compared to Russia overally speaking?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537593806368724d41200400#post_537593806368724d41200400
Russia's economy is a fucking joke and a half.
!http://37.media.tumblr.com/d22d756e6dd469a8619f5e4c58420ff7/tumblr_n53dc4eD7M1qaow2uo1_500.jpg!
(Almost a fifth of Russia's gdp comes from exports and their biggest export is oil.  If Russia stops exporting or gets sanctioned all it would really mean is the cost of your gas going up by a couple cents/pence or whatever monetary system you use)


Ever since Crimea joined Russia their economy took a huge nosedive.  On the other hand if Ukraine joins the EU they would just need a short term loan that they've already raised most of the money for.  If eastern Ukraine joins Russia then their economy is going to go (cartoon whistle sfx of something falling) SPLAT!

It's probably why Ukraine's citizens are uniting together now; if they join Russia they're fucked financially; if they stay with Ukraine whether or not they agree with it then they're going to be okay financially in the end.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537595036368724d41db0400#post_537595036368724d41db0400

Because this is something I thought about. In an alternate Universe with a brighter shade of "pink". What if Ukraine had used the tactic of surrendering and put up with Russia for some time. In that time, gathered intelligence and start working on the inside to overthrow it by turning Putin's detractors against him due to the obvious bad decisions and when the time comes, take Russia down.

Like what King Goujian did when he lost in the Battle of Wu during 473 a.C.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4
